item.title: Genshin Impact Leaks Character Customization Feature for Version 6.1
item.description:
A recent video from the Genshin Impact beta has revealed an overview of the new player customization options coming with Miliastra Wonderland in Version 6.1. In parallel to the Song of the Welkin Moon, one thing that Genshin Impact fans can look forward to in the Nod-Krai era is the Miliastra Wonderland – a sandbox mode that will allow players to create and engage with user-generated content. This new mode will be seamlessly integrated with the base game, though the development kit will have its own separate launcher.

One of the more interesting aspects of Miliastra Wonderland in Genshin Impact is its character creator. Players will be able to design their own Genshin Impact avatar, and not only will they be able to use it within the bounds of the sandbox mode, but they will also be able to explore Teyvat as this custom character. Dubbed Manekin (or Manekina), the Miliastra Wonderland character will need to be leveled separately in the base game, complete with its own set of ascension and talent materials.

Genshin Impact May Add Character Customization in Version 6.1

Version 6.1 will introduce Nefer to Genshin Impact , a Sumeru Flagship Event, and a new Act of the Archon Quest. However, it will also mark the beginning of the open beta for Miliastra Wonderland and its features. As such, players will be able to customize their Manekin starting from October 22, 2025. A video shared by Kuroo Leaks highlights the full scope of character customization options – from hairstyles and facial features to clothing and accessories.

Genshin Impact players can make detailed adjustments to the Manekin via a set of sliders, such as adjusting the iris size, accessory positioning, and more. While the method of acquisition isn't fully understood just yet, datamining has implied that Miliastra Wonderland will come with its own gacha currency, separate from Primogems in Genshin Impact . This implies that Miliastra Wonderland will come with its own set of premium outfits and banners.

While it won't feature a dye system, players will also be able to save and load several different profiles of their Manekin. One thing to also keep in mind is that the character customization, and Miliastra Wonderland as a whole, are only in their infancy. HoYoverse has promised that the sandbox mode will receive adequate developer support throughout the Nod Krai era in Genshin Impact . For now, the first iteration of Miliastra Wonderland should be open to all interested players with the launch of Version 6.1 on October 22, 2025.

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Step into Teyvat, a vast world teeming with life and flowing with elemental energy.

You and your sibling arrived here from another world. Separated by an unknown god, stripped of your powers, and cast into a deep slumber, you now awake to a world very different from when you first arrived.

Thus begins your journey across Teyvat to seek answers from The Seven — the gods of each element. Along the way, prepare to explore every inch of this wondrous world, join forces with a diverse range of characters, and unravel the countless mysteries that Teyvat holds...

MASSIVE OPEN WORLD
Climb any mountain, swim across any river, and glide over the world below, taking in the jaw-dropping scenery each step of the way. And if you stop to investigate a wandering Seelie or strange mechanism, who knows what you might discover?

ELEMENTAL COMBAT SYSTEM
Harness the seven elements to unleash elemental reactions. Anemo, Electro, Hydro, Pyro, Cryo, Dendro, and Geo interact in all sorts of ways, and Vision wielders have the power to turn this to their advantage.

Will you vaporize Hydro with Pyro, electro-charge it with Electro, or freeze it with Cryo? Your mastery of the elements will give you the upper hand in battle and exploration.

BEAUTIFUL VISUALS
Feast your eyes on the world around you, with a stunning art style, real-time rendering, and finely tuned character animations delivering you a truly immersive visual experience. Lighting and weather all change naturally over time, bringing every detail of this world to life.

SOOTHING SOUNDTRACK
Let the beautiful sounds of Teyvat draw you in as you explore the expansive world around you. Performed by the London Philharmonic Orchestra, the soundtrack changes seamlessly with the time and gameplay to match the mood.

BUILD YOUR DREAM TEAM
Team up with a diverse cast of characters in Teyvat, each with their own unique personalities, stories, and abilities. Discover your favorite party combinations and level up your characters to help you conquer even the most daunting of enemies and domains.

JOURNEY WITH FRIENDS
Team up with friends across various platforms to trigger more elemental action, tackle tricky boss fights, and conquer challenging domains together to reap rich rewards.

As you stand atop the peaks of Jueyun Karst and take in the rolling clouds and vast terrain stretching out before you, you may wish to stay in Teyvat a little longer... But until you are reunited with your lost sibling, how can you rest? Go forth, Traveler, and begin your adventure!

item.title: Gamer Turns Nintendo 64 Controller Into a Working Game Boy Advance
item.description:
A gamer has shared their project of modding a Nintendo 64 controller into a working, standalone Game Boy Advance. The project puts all the functionality of an actual Game Boy Micro, the smallest version of a Game Boy Advance, into a N64 controller, including a screen to play on.

Over the years, gamers and modders have come up with a wide variety of unusual console mods, including things like the tiniest Wii system to exist, or creating a Game Boy DS out of a Pokedex. Courtesy of the developments in technology over the years, many devices can now be retooled with small components, allowing them to be repackaged in smaller enclosures.

Gamer Creates N64 Controller That Works as a Game Boy Advance

In this new case, a Reddit user called MaSaKee rebuilt an original green N64 to work as a Game Boy Micro. The device actually works, with a rechargeable battery and a built-in screen. To make the build, MaSaKee created a small hole in the front of the N64 controller to place the 2-inch Game Boy Micro display. Unlike some mod projects, this one is made to actually use original GBA catridges. MaSaKee modified the N64 expansion port so that it could play Game Boy Advance cartridges, which they chose to demonstrate with a photo of a Castlevania cartridge inserted into the controller.

Further modifications to the device include the ability to turn the device on and off with a switch on the expansion port, as well as a USB-C port, and a headphone jack accessible on the back of the controller. There are some differences in the control schemes and number of buttons between the two devices, so MaSaKee also made some changes to how the buttons on the N64 controller work. The Z button on the back of the controller was converted to work as a Select button on the GBA, while the C buttons were retooled to control the volume and brightness of the screen.

The post has gained considerable attention and praise from the community, racking up nearly 5,000 upvotes at the time of publication. While some mods like these are arguably impractical to use, if one were willing to play on the Game Boy Micro's small screen, this one would likely provide a fun experience. Numerous modders have previously shared their own mash-up mods that combine multiple Nintendo systems, so this won't be the last time that players see a curious creation like this one.

item.title: How to Unlock All COD Black Ops 7 Beta Rewards
item.description:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 7's launch is rapidly approaching, with players around the world able to jump in and experience the full game on November 14. However, players can actually get a taste of it much sooner, with the Black Ops 7 Beta launching into early access on October 2, followed by the Open Beta running from October 5 to October 8.

The Black Ops 7 Beta is an excellent way for players to test out a slice of the full game prior to launch. With a solid chunk of Multiplayer content, including six maps, plus the ability to play Zombie Survival on Vandorn Farm starting on day two of the Beta, there’s plenty to enjoy. On top of that, the Beta also gives players the chance to earn some exclusive rewards. Here’s every Black Ops 7 Beta reward.

All Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Beta Rewards

The first set of Beta rewards that players can earn is awarded in-game by taking part in the Beta. These rewards are unlocked by leveling up during the Black Ops 7 Beta , live from October 2 to October 8 at 10 AM PT. All rewards will carry over to Black Ops 7 when it launches in November.

Here’s a full rundown of all the rewards you can earn and how to unlock them:

Reward

How To Unlock

Beta Player (Animated Emblem)

Reach level 2 during the Beta

Gun Flex (Emote)

Reach level 6 during the Beta

Beta Neon (Sticker)

Reach level 11 during the Beta

Beta Beasts (Weapon Charm)

Reach level 15 during the Beta

Wei Lin (Operator Skin)

Falkner (Pre-Order Only Operator Skin)

Reach level 20 during the Beta

Beta Survivor (Loading Screen)

Reach level 23 during the Beta

Beta Conqueror (Calling Card)

Reach level 27 during the Beta

Beta Legend (M15 MOD O Blueprint)

Reach level 30 during the Beta

All Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Beta Twitch Drop Rewards

On top of rewards earnable by playing the Beta, players can also unlock a bunch of Twitch Drop rewards usable in Black Ops 7 at launch. To claim Black Ops 7 Beta Twitch Drop rewards, simply tune into any stream in the Black Ops 7 category on Twitch from October 2 to October 8 at 10 AM PT and watch for the required time. Once done, you can claim each drop inside your Twitch Drop Inventory. These rewards are as follows:

  • Third Eye (Weapon Charm)
  • Going Live (Emblem)
  • Beta Prepped (Calling Card)
  • Helm Piercer (Weapon Blueprint)

To receive Black Ops 7 Twitch Drops in-game, be sure to link both your Activision and Twitch accounts together here.

item.title: How to Get Free Leopard Print Cosmetics in Fortnite
item.description:
Back in Chapter 1, free cosmetics didn't come around all that often, but that has changed quite a lot since then. Nowadays, Epic Games constantly giving fans opportunity to get freebies in Fortnite - whether it's by completing quests, being part of events, or participating in tournaments.

This week, players have a chance to claim two leopard print cosmetics in Fortnite completely free of cost. Whether they enjoy this clothing pattern or simply want to collect as many in-game cosmetics as possible, gamers should definitely make sure they don't miss out on this opportunity.

How to Get Free Leopard Print Cosmetics in Fortnite

Fortnite is giving away two leopard print cosmetics this week: the Leopard's Hoard back bling and the Woven Fang pickaxe . To get these items added to their Fortnite locker, players will have to participate in the Blitz Mobile Cup taking place on Wednesday, October 1, 2025 .

While Epic Games has announced that these items will be this week's tournament rewards, it has not updated the prize information on the competition's official rules sheet. However, if it is handed out similarly to the Corvo rewards, players can expect the Leopard's Hoard back bling to given away to everyone that scores 5 points in the Blitz Mobile Cup and the Woven Fang pickaxe to be handed to the top players in each region .

It is unknown if these rewards will permanently replace the Corvo items or if they are an extra reward that is being given away for limited time.

Blitz Mobile Cup Schedule & Rules

Despite the fact that the official rules have not been updated with the most recent prizes, this is a weekly cup and the rules are consider unaltered compared to last week's. Therefore the Blitz Mobile Cup taking place on October 1 takes place in the Blitz game mode, as the name indicates, and it is expected to be a solo competition.

item.title: Pokemon TCG Chart Shows Most Expensive Cards in Mega Evolution
item.description:
A new Pokemon TCG chart is showing the most expensive cards from the Mega Evolution expansion, with a pair of extremely rare cards worth over $400. Mega Evolution has brought a plethora of changes to the game for both players and collectors, with the return of Mega Pokemon serving as one of the biggest changes in the set. The Pokemon TCG also introduced a brand-new rarity to the game with the set's release, adding two new cards in the "Mega Hyper Rare" rarity. Now, some of those cards are boasting some exorbitant prices.

Mega Evolution came with a plethora of high-profile cards for players to collect, including some stunning new Special Illustration Rare cards. Six of the ten new Mega Pokemon received their own Special Illustration Rare versions within the expansion, featuring fan-favorites like Mega Absol and Mega Venusaur. The introduction of Mega Hyper Rare also saw the set's two cover Pokemon receive impressive gold versions, debuting Mega Hyper Rare cards for Mega Gardevoir and Mega Lucario. Some of the Pokemon TCG 's newest cards now command some high price tags.

A new chart shared by Twitter aggregator Pokemon Drop & Restock Alerts is detailing the price points of the ten most expensive cards in Mega Evolution. The two Mega Hyper Rare cards stand as the highest-priced cards in the set, with Mega Lucario ex valued at $541.42 and Mega Gardevoir ex at $489.16. Mega Gardevoir serves as the most expensive of the set's group of Special Illustration Rares, priced at $283.35, with Mega Lucario ex's Special Illustration Rare following close behind at $277.59. Mega Venusaur ex rounds out the Top 5 cards in the set, available for $217.60.

Pokemon TCG Chart Shows Most Expensive Mega Evolution Cards

  • Mega Lucario ex (Mega Hyper Rare) : $541.42
  • Mega Gardevoir ex (Mega Hyper Rare) : $489.16
  • Mega Gardevoir ex (Special Illustration Rare) : $283.35
  • Mega Lucario ex (Special Illustration Rare) : $277.59
  • Mega Venusaur ex (Special Illustration Rare) : $217.60
  • Mega Latias ex (Special Illustration Rare) : $211.28
  • Lillie's Determination (Special Illustration Rare) : $180.26
  • Mega Absol ex (Special Illustration Rare) : $102.62
  • Mega Kangaskhan ex (Special Illustration Rare) : $102.61
  • Marshadow (Special Illustration Rare) : $78.32

Mega Evolution's price points have seen many of the expected cards sitting near the top of the set. The list notably only features one Trainer card priced in the Top 10 of the set, with the Special Illustration Rare version of Lillie's Determination sitting at 8th place in Mega Evolution, valued at $180.26. Lillie's Determination is also expected to be a powerhouse in the competitive meta for the TCG, likely becoming a staple Supporter card for its ability to reset its user's hand and draw into different cards.

The Mega Evolution expansion has added plenty more than just expensive cards to the TCG, with plenty of powerful new strategies debuting. Grass-focused Decks received some major boosts following the set's release, with "Forest of Vitality" allowing players to evolve Grass Pokemon early and Meganium's Ability providing powerful ramping effects. Mega Gardevoir ex will also slot nicely into the pre-existing Gardevoir deck as another late-game option for Gardevoir players to close out a game. Pokemon TCG 's Mega Evolution brings lots to the table for both players and collectors.
